result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hurley S Jones

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Hurley S Jones in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Hurley S Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Hughes provides an update; he has received the blood test results as well as an updated offer.  Atty. Hughes requests another further proceedings in about 45 days.  State notes that they filed an Amended Information adding Count 4 based on the blood test results.  Atty. Hughes acknowledges receipt, waives reading of Amended Information and enters initial not guilty plea.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Laboratory report filed by the State.

9:21 AM Defendant Hurley S Jones in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Hurley S Jones.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court informs defendant that his shirt is not appropriate to wear to court.  Village of Menomonee Falls Police Officer Vincent Strom sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Pitzo.  Cross examination by Atty. Hughes.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty Pitzo moves for bind over.  Atty. Hughes objects to bind over.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's 90 day start

ADDRESS INFO for Hurley S Jones
Current: C/O Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2022)
Prior: 5847 N 81St St, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.

1:24 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Hurley S Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Hurley S Jones. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
